topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d) a(props sp-version) a(props pmc_switch) a(props pmc_package) a(props pmc_phy) a(props ddr-width) a(props package) a(props fw_package) a(props pcie-drive-ports ) a(props pcie-host-ports) a(props raid-support ) a(props sas-ports ) a(props media) a(props component)
topic.title: Client Mapping Example Code

body.p: The following example code can be used to create a MAPOTN segment. Note that the mapping operation is 1:1 hard linked with the client side channel which could be Ethernet or Interlaken, as such, this operation takes in the same chnl_id as an earlier call to g5_api_enet_prov() or g5_api_ilkn_pkt_prov().
body.codeblock:
UINT32 device_id = 0x8817; UINT32 enet_odu_chnl_id = 0x3000;
rc = g5_api_client_map_cfg(device_id, enet_chnl_id, G5_MAP_ODU4_100GE_GMP, // mode 0, // client_num_incr G5_GFP_SLICE_CFG_AUTO); // gfp_slice
body.p: The following example code can be used to tear down all aspects of the segment created by the client map function.
